titleStmt.title: Decree 229-228 BC
titleStmt.author: Ptolemy III Evergetes, king of Egypt

msContents.summary: Copy of a royal decree addressing people with properties or those who administer such properties in their absence; they should give evaluation of the properties in order to determine a 2% tax as a money "dorea"; only in the Alexandrian district the declarations take place before certain priests; penalties in case of evasion depend upon the owners

msItemStruct.note: 28 lines written across the fibers; on the front P.Col. IV 85
Only the left part of the document is preserved; a false margin was created by pasting a strip of papyrus on the right edge
The assignment of the money grant to priests, which is considered certain in the editio princeps, is considered as doubtful in C.Ord.Ptol. 28, p. 67

Written in the 19 year of a Ptolemy not named; the small hand is clear, but not calligraphic and has the characteristics of a third century hand; this seems to exclude the possibility that the document was written in the reign of Ptolemy V

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman and New York dealer J. Brummer, through H.I. Bell, November 1925; no. 25 (original no. 46) in Bell
